headline: The changing face of J.D. Vance
sentences: He made the rounds on talk shows like Charlie Rose? and NPRs Fresh Air? explaining the conditions and mindset that had led so many people to support then-presidential candidate Donald Trump.
Magazine writer Simon van Zuylen-Wood followed Vance for weeks to try to understand his transformation and what his candidacy says about the state of the Republican Party.
Hes a staunch member of a splinter group of the Republican Party called national conservatism, that advocates for tighter borders and cracking down on big business.
Today on Post Reports,? were talking about the transformation of one candidate from never-Trumper to Trumps pick for Ohios open Senate seat.
Vance was known for his memoir Hillbilly Elegy,? about the ravages of poverty and drug use in his Ohio town.
If youre curious to learn more about the Ohio primary, read The Trailer from The Posts Dave Weigel.
Vance is now the frontrunner for the Republican nomination for Ohios empty Senate seat.
And hes embraced Trump and his values, earning him the former presidents endorsement.
This Tuesday, Ohioans will vote in the primary ahead of this falls midterm elections.
Today on Post Reports,? we take you inside Vances campaign.
Back in 2016, commentator and venture capitalist J.D.
But he himself decried Trumps rise.
